shortdesc.ph: Several profiling attributes can be aggregated into a profiling condition set that allow you to apply more complex filters on the document content. A Profiling Condition Set is a very powerful and convenient tool used to preview the content that goes into the published output. For example, an installation manual available both in Windows and Linux variants can be profiled to highlight only the Linux procedures for more advanced users.

context.p: To create a new profiling condition set:

step.cmd:
Open the Profiling/Conditional Text preferences page from application's toolbar Options Preferences Editor Edit modes Author menu
Window Preferences oXygen Editor Edit modes Author Profiling / Conditional Text .
In the Profiling Condition Sets area, press the New button.

substep.info: If you want the Profiling Condition Set to refer a DITAVAL file, enable the Use DITAVAL file option and select the DITAVAL file from your disk.

substep.cmd: Choose the document type for which you have previously defined profiling attributes.
substep.stepresult: After choosing a document type, all profiling attributes and their possible values are listed in the central area of the dialog.

substep.cmd: Define the combination of attribute values by ticking the appropriate checkboxes.

step.cmd: Click Apply to save the condition set. All saved profiling condition sets are available in the Profiling / Conditional Text toolbar menu.
